Yeah exactly ðŸ˜„

You can make the attack slightly worse by sending more conflicting blobs to more peers, but it'll be the exact same root cause and won't mean anything new.

author: barnabasbusa

author: parithosh
content: teku nodes are updated

author: m.kalinin
content: This kind of attack looks similar to disseminating a blob or a block to a portion of nodes in a network by releasing near to the attestation boundary of a slot causing a split

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: My abstract idea is that if this is not punished, then it means the cost of attack is free. So spam can be almost unlimited. This smells of possible network disturbance, not to mention that some clients may even not fetch the right blob if some uncovered edge case is triggered. But let's hope anti-dos protection works well.

author: roberto.bayardo
content:
<@412614104222531604> (or whoever else can help), any way we can get the deterministic deploy proxy live on the devnet? https://github.com/Zoltu/deterministic-deployment-proxy
We are trying to deploy an op-stack L2 on the devnet which leverages this proxy.  pre-155 transactions are currently blocked by the devnet RPC it seems. cc <@656728086410297356>

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: running your own geth node with `--rpc.allow-unprotected-txs ` will allow you to send pre-155 txs

author: terence0083
